descriptive_fields.accident_summary: A black sedan, traveling at a high rate of speed, rear-ends a slow-moving vehicle towing red agricultural equipment. The impact causes the sedan to launch into the air, flip, and roll violently multiple times, scattering a large amount of debris across the highway before coming to a rest.
descriptive_fields.liability_indicator: The driver of Vehicle A (black sedan) is likely at fault. The collision was a direct rear-end impact with a slow-moving vehicle, indicating the driver of Vehicle A failed to maintain control, was driving too fast for the conditions, or was inattentive to the road ahead.

reasoning_trace: 00:00 - Video begins with the recording vehicle following Black SUV (Vehicle C) on a multi-lane highway.
00:02 - Another black sedan (Vehicle A) is observed rapidly closing the distance to Vehicle B (towing equipment) ahead in the same lane.
00:03 - Vehicle A impacts the rear of the towed equipment of Vehicle B without any visible braking or evasive action.
00:03 - 00:05 - The collision's force causes Vehicle A to become airborne, flip end over end, and roll multiple times, disintegrating as it travels down the road.
00:06 - The wreckage of Vehicle A and scattered debris are visible across the highway as the recording vehicle slows.
